Fig. 1.1 shows the set up. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 101, 784, 454]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 467, 532, 486]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 498, 146, 516]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 498, 918, 533]]<|/det|> The student adjusts the length of the pendulum until the distance \(d\) measured from the bottom of the support to the centre of the bob is \(90.0 \text{cm}\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 545, 662, 564]]<|/det|> He displaces the bob slightly and releases it so that it swings. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 575, 798, 594]]<|/det|> He measures, and records in Table 1.1, the time \(t\) for 10 complete oscillations. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 606, 920, 640]]<|/det|> Calculate, and record in Table 1.1, the period \(T\) of the pendulum. The period is the time for 1 complete oscillation. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 651, 554, 670]]<|/det|> Calculate a value for \(T^2\) and record in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[893, 652, 920, 670]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 684, 541, 701]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 714, 838, 800]]<|/det|>
\(d/\mathrm {cm}\)\(t/\)\(T/\)\(T^{2}/\)

45.013.5
